result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Benjamin R Topp not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Judgment on bail forfeiture. Minutes filed.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin R Topp not in court. Warrant to issue. Bond ordered forfeited. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM dob 1/10/1992 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Benjamin R Topp in court. ADA Sam Berg present in Court. Called @ 2:11 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for bond hearing. Record by the State as to bond. Response by Mr. Topp who asks that the victim be removed from his home as she does not live there, and lives in Janesville. Further discussion.
Court sets bond at $1000.00 signature bond
#1, #4, #5, #9
No contact with the victim (d.o.b. 1/10/1992) or her residence.
Court in recess.
Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
